body_content.explanation: a road accident in which the driver who caused the accident drives away without helping the other people involved and without telling the police:
examples: The 24-year-old was the victim of a hit and run, killed by a speeding truck.
She was charged in relation to a hit and run after she allegedly left the scene of an accident.

body_content.explanation: A hit-and-run road accident is one in which the driver who caused the accident drives away without helping the other people involved and without telling the police:
examples: He struck and killed a pedestrian in a hit-and-run accident.
A traffic policeman was killed by a hit and run driver.

body_content.explanation: A hit-and-run military attack needs to happen unexpectedly and quickly in order to be successful:
examples: Rebels are launching hit-and-run raids on army positions throughout the country.
The remaining rebels will melt into the jungle and continue a hit and run war.

body_content.explanation: a road accident in which the driver who caused the accident drives away without helping the other people involved and without telling the police:
examples: Their five-year-old daughter was killed in a hit-and-run.
Three people were injured in separate hit and runs in Glasgow last night.

body_content.explanation: in baseball, an occasion when a player who has reached one of the bases (= one of the four positions that a player must reach to score a point) begins to run to the next base as soon as the pitcher throws the ball, expecting that the batter will hit the ball:
examples: A perfectly executed hit-and-run advanced Kennedy to third base.
The manager decided to put on a hit-and-run.
